mortality.note: UNDERSTATED FIGURE. Only counts Middle Passage deaths (~12.5M embarked, ~10.7M disembarked). TRUE TOLL much higher: millions more died in African capture raids, coastal holding, and on plantations. Some historians estimate 4-6M died before even boarding ships. Total system deaths possibly 10-15M+. This entry measures transport mortality only.

rationales.systematic_intensity: Centuries-long infrastructure: forts, ships, auctions, plantations, legal codes. State-chartered companies.
rationales.profit: Pure economic extraction. Entire colonial economies built on enslaved labor. Sugar, cotton, tobacco.
rationales.ideology: Racism developed to justify the system, but profit preceded and drove the ideology.
rationales.complicity: European consumers, investors, insurers all benefited. 'Triangle trade' enriched multiple continents.

analysis.pattern_note: The definitive example of Profit-Driven Attrition. Ideology score is low (20%) because racism was often a consequence of the system, not the initial driver, though religious justification ('saving souls') was used.
analysis.root_causes: Labor demand in colonies, profit motive, development of racial capitalism
